intro: Elephantopus piauiensis, commonly known as the Piaui elephant's foot, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its unique, swollen, tuberous roots that resemble an elephant's foot. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in dry and semi-arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appearance and medicinal properties.
